roleset.name: expect

example.name: active, light S as object
example.text: The documents also said that Cray Computer anticipates needing perhaps another $ 120 million in financing beginning next September .

propbank.arg: needing perhaps another $ 120 million in financing beginning next September

example.name: active, SBAR as object
example.text: But speculators , anticipating that Connecticut will approve a law permitting such interstate banking soon , immediately bid up shares of Connecticut banks on the news .

propbank.arg: that Connecticut will approve a law permitting such interstate banking soon

example.name: passivized with extraction
example.text: John is anticipated to win the Nobel Prize .

example.name: with comparative
example.text: `` This is all emotion right now , and when emotion starts to run , it can run further than anyone anticipates , '' he said .

example.name: arg 1
example.text: gleeful anticipation of getting a share of this market

propbank.arg: of getting a share of this market

example.name: Both args
example.text: His anticipation of the blow saved it from doing serious damage

roleset.note: ANTICIPATE-V NOTES: No verbnet entry. Comparison with 'expect' (from anticipate.01-v)
ANTICIPATION-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Comparison to 'anticipate.01' No Vn or Fn classes. Framed by Katie. (from anticipation.01-n)
Sometimes also with an empty Arg1 (trace only) (from anticipate.01-v)

roleset.name: come before

example.name: active
example.text: The downgrade anticipates completion of the IMA Holdings acquisition today , Moody 's said .

propbank.arg: completion of the IMA Holdings acquisition today

roleset.note: ANTICIPATE-V NOTES: These two senses are very close in meaning, but fortunately theframing is the same. (from anticipate.02-v)
